content.description: Start lower left on boulder work handholds up and right to a top at
content.location: First boulder on Low Streamside trail

content.description: SDS, start matched on right facing corner, right of the overhang (problem moves from right to left).  Move left to and thru the overhang into a small recessed cave.  Move left out of cave onto face with the horizontal scars, work across the face and wrap around the corner to finish the problem, nice v3...for beta  youtube.com/watch?v=YioCqMb…
content.location: On left side of streamside path first major boulder section you come to.

content.description: Just to the left of the middle arête, start on left downward facing jug, work up step-like holds to top.    NEEDS CLEANING!
content.location: Found on Cats Cradle Boulder just before small creek crossing on Low Streamside trail

content.description:
Located on the front all the way to the left.  SDS low on the arête, work way up slopers on arête and top out to left of small overhang. 

youtube.com/watch?v=TCMrUv7…
content.location: Located directly on high streamside trail

content.description: Start  on low on arête, work up arête and move right to a top out in upper right corner.
content.location: On Left Streamside trail, found on a separate boulder to left of flat wall.

content.description: Sit down start to Separation Anxiety, start on crimps below the first horizontal crack on the first level, get a high left foot and continue on with the rest of Separation Axniety....beta youtube.com/watch?v=f_75WyB…
content.location: Streamside path up stream from Atriox Dept on same side of the stream.  On the Jugs Not Hugs boulder.

content.description:
Start matched on lower rail and move up to second level using right facing flakes and crimps to top out. 

youtube.com/watch?v=TCMrUv7…
content.location: On the Jugs Not Hugs Boulder on the Left Streamside Trail

content.description: Start on left side of the middle recess, traverse left across bottom of wall to far left arête and move up the face to a top out.
content.location: On the Left Streamside trail just after crossing the stream

content.description: TO the left of against the grain, Flow arete to easy top out.
content.location: left of

content.description:
Start same Small Change.  Traverse across the front face through some core intensive moves and work around the right arete to the back face and traverse up and right to a nice easy step off.     The frist half gets you pumped so keep it together for the last half. 

youtube.com/watch?v=VU_9xIZ…
content.protection: At least 2 pads and 1 spotter, but will need to move pads more will be better, it is a long problem. Last half of the problem has a bad fall but has good hand holds, Just keep it together and pad it up
content.location: Found on the Money Maker boulder on the Upper stream side trail

content.description:
Start on good holds at head height on the right side of the face. Make committing moves to good holds straight up the face. 

youtu.be/OCqd1jR-1Sw
content.protection: At least 3 pads and a spotter, more of both is probably best
content.location: Earth Treks boulder on upper stream side trail

content.description: Start on a crack on the right side of the left wall.  Move out to crimp on right side arête and move up to find a good jug and top out.
content.protection: Pad and Spotter to stop you from rolling into the stream
content.location: On the Stream Boulder on the Low Streamside trail.  Sits right down on the stream, easy to miss if you start walking uphill again you have gone too far

content.description: Start on left side of wall on downward right angled rail and move straight up toward the tree.   Watch out for loose jugs at top!
content.location: Found off the High Streamside trail on the Glass wall to the right of Don't Step Back

content.description: Start on left side of the left face, start matched on left facing vertical rail, work up rail to the top.   NEEDS CLEANING!
content.location: Found on Cats Cradle Boulder just before small creek crossing on Low Streamside trail

content.description: Start just to the right of Catwalk with right in crack and left on head height left facing crimp, move up and right to top.
content.location: Found on Cats Cradle Boulder just before the small creek crossing on the Low Streamside trail

content.description: **PROJECT***Start on right facing overhang on undercling @ head height move straight up to good jugs, then work left to find a good undercling pocket and move up face to left of big flake.Rating just an estimate for now.
content.location: On Left Streamside trail on first major boulder after crossing the stream

content.description: Start on right side of right face on best holds you can find at head height, work up and left to the top.
content.location: Found on Cats Cradle Boulder just before the small creek crossing on the Low Streamside trail

content.description: Start on a crack on the right side of the left wall, move to block on face of right wall and work way up the face to a top out.
content.protection: Pad and Spotter to stop you from rolling into the stream
content.location: Sits right down on the stream, easy to miss if you start walking uphill again you have gone too far

content.description: Start in middle of face on a crimpy flake and crimp at about head height, then climb straight up.
content.protection: Pad, probably can't get a spotter on the ledge
content.location: Found on high streamside trail up hill from the Money Maker boulder.

content.description: Start on right side of wall few feet from arête, start on crimp rail at about waist height and work your way straight up.
content.location: On high streamside trail one of the first to come upon. Someone recently added the batman logo on the wall.

content.description:
Start matched on undercling on right side of overhang on the back wall.  Work out the overhang using underclings and crimps to the same finish jug as Crystal Crimps, establish on the face and jump down.  

*DO NOT TOP OUT do to excessive vegetation and choss**

vimeo.com/88058722
content.location: On Left Streamside trail on first major boulder after crossing the stream. Atriox Dept. boulder

content.description:
SDS on good holds under the Quartz line, follow the Quartz line to a solid pinch for the right, then work your way out from underneath and move up to establish on the face and you're done.  Down climb to get off. 

Don't Top Out! It is just a bunch of choss and vegetation.

youtube.com/watch?v=lZjS_Oc…
content.location: On Left Streamside trail on first major boulder after crossing the stream

content.description: On the Crystal Boulder. Ideally start the same as "the tale of two traverses", but go the opposite direction (up and right). The next obvious jug is roughly 6 feet off the ground. Skipping to this hold does not affect the grade (the space in between is often wet & grimy).  There are two obvious roof jugs to establish yourself above head height before reaching left for the huge left side pull. Traverse to the left and work your body onto the cave's arete. Getting fully onto the arete is the crux.  Once you can stand on the arete to a no-hands-rest the problem is essentially over.  The end point is almost the same as crystal crimps, but you'll most likely end slightly more to the right. Convention would be to top out straight above you, but that is often wet and extremely chossy.  You can also traverse further left toward the V1 top outs.  Either way the top out is just V-intro and I promise you've earned a V3 send regardless of how you chose to get down.  Just make good calls for the conditions and your pad situation. It's one of the best routes streamside (according to my circles at least). VERY BURLY for a V3 and aptly named.   It flows smoothly with good foot work, but it's a pretty particular style so feel free to debate the grade.  Someone with great crimps, but less shoulder power might find it more comparable to the difficulty of crystal crimps (adjacent v4). Pad note:  I've seen some pretty dramatically different beta for this route produce a lot of variation in the fall zone. You don't need a sea of pads but I recommend being extra cognizant of how foot positions affect the falls. video of a few climbers trying the problem: youtu.be/ZLIHzdP1hhQ
content.location: Crystal boulder on the streamside (but opposite of the water from the main lot). Start in the back of cave toward the climbers right.

content.description: Start on far left on horizontal scars,  traverse right to about the middle of wall then work up for a top out.
content.location: On Left Streamside trail on first major boulder after crossing the stream

content.description: SDS underneath the overhang on good holds, work out from under the overhang onto the right facing wall and top out.
content.location: Located on the opposite side of the road across the stream, first rock you see with an overhang   Best way to approach would be walk down the road across the bridge and find the trail.

content.description: Start just right of the middle arête on left facing rail @ about head height, work up and slightly right to the top.   NEEDS CLEANING!
content.location: Found on Cats Cradle Boulder just before small creek crossing on Low Streamside trail

content.description: Far left of binary wall. CLimb clear crack line to top out.
content.location: Binary Wall

content.description: Start on right side of the wall just to the left of the crack/cave, work slightly left then up to top out.
content.location: On Left Streamside trail on first main boulder after crossing the stream

content.description: Start in middle of wall on a chest high crimp directly below a side pull.  Move up to the side pull then slightly right and up.
content.location: Located on Damn Youths wall on the high streamside trail

content.description: Located on the same side of the road as the parking lot.  Has a lot of easy access bouldering with approach under 5 minutes.  3 main trails, High, Low, and Left Streamside trails.
